channel.title: Phoenix Continued
channel.description:
[center] [size=18pt][font=arial black]Phoenix Continued[/font][/size] I have decided to pick Phoenix back up for one last time, I will slowly implement more content in hope that someone may finally decide to use this server and create something truly great. I'll keep the update list and media list updated as I go. Phoenix is my own framework and has been in development for near six months, granted I lost interest frequently.
Both types of disconnections are now fully handled. Purposeful and forced. Player hands no longer disappear when boots are worn. Stores are now parsed from an external text file. Stores now display the items and stock correctly. Support for multiple stores added. All of the optional and head based dialogue frames have been loaded. An abstract dialogue system has been put in place to support transition between dialogues. Scheduled pulses are now canceled when the owner logs out or is nullified. Fixed a few potential exploits in the item associated incoming packets. Rewrote a portion of networking code to support X-Logging and handle it accordingly. Added support for interacting with mobs. Both mobs and players now face each other during an interaction.
[size=18pt][font=arial black]Media[/font][/size] [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/2r77xa0.png[/img] [IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/5vx4cw.png[/img] [IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/2edwleh.png[/img] [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/23wac6v.png[/img] [IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/f0ntpu.png[/img] [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/2iizt5k.png[/img] [size=18pt][font=arial black]Code Examples[/font][/size] [url=http://pastebin.com/sfuxTHBg] View Dialogue Example [/url] [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,657971.msg4401212.html#msg4401212] View Recent Release [/url] [/center]

item.title: Phoenix Continued
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

[quote=“Fabrice L, post:37, topic:545826”]Why don’t you use the command packet, it’s easy to do, here you have it:

[code]
package com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.receive;

import com.phoenix.runescape.item.Item;
import com.phoenix.runescape.mobile.player.Player;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacket;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacketListener;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacketOpcode;

@IncomingPacketOpcode( 103 )

public final class CommandPacketListener extends IncomingPacketListener {

@Override
public void operate(Player player, IncomingPacket packet) {
	int messageSize = packet.getLength() - 1;
	byte message[] = packet.readBytes(messageSize);
	String command = new String(message);
	
	if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("test")) {
		player.getInventoryContainer().addItem(new Item(995, 1000));
	}
}

}[/code][/quote]

Thanks, ill add that packet in. It was one of those things I just keep procrastinating adding.

Read full topic

item.title: Phoenix Continued
item.dc:creator: @Fabrice_L Fabrice L
item.description:
@Fabrice_L wrote:

Why don’t you use the command packet, it’s easy to do, here you have it:

[code]
package com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.receive;

import com.phoenix.runescape.item.Item;
import com.phoenix.runescape.mobile.player.Player;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacket;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacketListener;
import com.phoenix.runescape.network.packet.IncomingPacketOpcode;

@IncomingPacketOpcode( 103 )

public final class CommandPacketListener extends IncomingPacketListener {

@Override
public void operate(Player player, IncomingPacket packet) {
	int messageSize = packet.getLength() - 1;
	byte message[] = packet.readBytes(messageSize);
	String command = new String(message);
	
	if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("test")) {
		player.getInventoryContainer().addItem(new Item(995, 1000));
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

Because it was just an example of shop loading and displaying.

Ryley you just want to suckle on my genius teet.

Ill upload it to Github once i get a few more fixes in and actually document my current code.

no i want to see how shitty you wrote it <3
[/quote]

You just say the word and ill drive ten minutes down route 8 and lay down the law.

But honestly some of the recent code is a little shitty and I haven’t finished making it presentable yet…[/quote]

word

item.title: Phoenix Continued
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

nolan2131:

Loveandpower’s Final Judgement. Of course, it was not structurally sound (Although it could have been if he wanted it to be), but it definitely benefited the community during the beginning stages of project insanity.

I love L&P but he isn’t a successful programmer and final judgement did not benefit this, or any other community as a whole. By “it was not structurally sound” you mean it was horribly designed. Please explain to me how half functioning badly written code benefits the community?

Graham is a successful programmer, and his releases have changed the way we look at runescape servers.

[quote=“nolan2131, post:23, topic:545826”][quote author=Ocyn_ link=topic=664709.msg4443862#msg4443862 date=1407861626]

You’ll have to rewrite almost everything within the core and content part.
